[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Lead processing system (LPS) defines requirements for an automated lead processing system ensuring accuracy, efficiency, and compliance with enterprise policies.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: LPS supports lead validation, scoring, assignment, and reporting within enterprise-defined processing time constraints.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: LPS integrates with enterprise lead processing, vendor validation, and ARA systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: LPS provides a secure UI for administrators to manage lead parameters and review reports.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: LPS runs on scalable cloud infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: LPS utilizes REST APIs and XML-based data formats for lead integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: LPS ensures encrypted lead data transmission via TLS 1.3.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: LPS is optimized for high-throughput lead processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: LPS supports 24/7 lead processing with scheduled updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: LPS allows configurable scoring rules per institution.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: LPS links to enterprise validation, billing, and admissions systems.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: LPS facilitates lead validation, scoring, assignment, and reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: LPS is designed for vendors, admissions representatives, and administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: LPS requires real-time data access and compliance with enterprise lead policies.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: LPS relies on enterprise validation services, ARA, and vendor data sources.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Lead Processing: Validation, scoring, and assignment of leads.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with the enterprise billing system for credit validation.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall interface with ARA for lead assignment.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall support XML-based data formats for processing.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall score and assign leads using contact, academic data, and scoring rules (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall receive periodic updates of available representatives (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an administrator interface for managing lead processing rules.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process 90% of leads within 5 minutes during peak hours, 99% within 3 minutes during off-hours, and evaluate 97% within 25 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store lead validation, scoring, and assignment records for auditing.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall operate within the enterprise web service structure.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall comply with enterprise security policies.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to data validation and API security best practices.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain 99.5% uptime, implementing automated recovery and failover mechanisms to minimize service disruptions.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Lead processing, scoring, and validation shall be performance tested.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Security policies, API guides, processing logs.
[SEC] 5. References: Industry standards for lead processing, XML, and security compliance.
